I'm not sure what you are suggesting here? I am currently building the Docker image gpu-devel. It looks like the other image expects to install a prebuilt wheel. I like the ability to build from scratch and not rely on external files.

I was trying to suggest a way of cutting down the size of this image. Perhaps there is a better image for what I want, but so far the ones I am seeing are just wrappers around prebuilt binaries.

EDIT: Also if I understand that linked script, it calls ci_parameterized_build.sh which expects to build the wheels outside of a Docker environment?

body:
I'm not sure what you are suggesting here? I am currently building the Docker image gpu-devel. It looks like the other image expects to install a prebuilt wheel. I like the ability to build from scratch and not rely on e[xternal files](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/891f8f73cc1967a5c2da89057884bc3dc1f9091a/tensorflow/tools/docker/Dockerfile.gpu#L45).

I was trying to suggest a way of cutting down the size of this image. Perhaps there is a better image for what I want, but so far the ones I am seeing are just wrappers around prebuilt binaries.

EDIT: Also if I understand that linked script, it calls `ci_parameterized_build.sh` which expects to build the wheels outside of a Docker environment?
